meanings.definition: To make a statement based on personal knowledge or belief.
meanings.sent1: She testifies that she saw the cat in the garden.
meanings.sent2: He testifies his innocence in front of the judge.
meanings.sent3: The parrot testifies about who ate the cookies.
meanings.sent4: The old tree testifies to the passing of time with its rings.
meanings.sent5: The witness testifies confidently about what she saw.

meanings.definition: To serve as evidence or proof.
meanings.sent1: The fingerprints on the weapon testifies to his guilt.
meanings.sent2: The data testifies to the effectiveness of the new treatment.
meanings.sent3: The broken vase testifies to the cat's mischievous behavior.
meanings.sent4: The blooming flowers testifies to the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The clear sky testifies to good weather for the picnic.

meanings.definition: To give testimony in a court of law.
meanings.sent1: The witness testifies in the murder trial.
meanings.sent2: The defendant testifies about his whereabouts on the night of the crime.
meanings.sent3: The judge testifies to the importance of honesty in court.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer's argument testifies to his dedication to the case.
meanings.sent5: The court reporter testifies to the accuracy of the transcript.
